greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle: number of exactly (m-1)-dimensional partitions of n, for n >= 1, m >= 0.
comment: The partition of 1 is considered to be dimension -1 by convention.
link: Suresh Govindarajan, Rows n = 1..26 of Triangle
Suresh Govindarajan, Partitions Generator (gives partitions of integers <= 25 in any dimension using this triangle).
Suresh Govindarajan, Refined counting of higher-dimensional partitions
Suresh Govindarajan, Notes on higher-dimensional partitions, arXiv preprint arXiv:1203.4419, 2012.
formula: a(n,m) = A096806(n,m-1)-a(n,m-1). Binomial transform of n-th row lists the (m-1) dimensional partitions of n.
results.author: _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, May 11 2006
